meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or idle.
meanings.sent1: The faineants in the park slept all day.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the faineants for not doing their homework.
meanings.sent3: The faineants decided to have a lazy day at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The faineants were like sloths, moving slowly and reluctantly.
meanings.sent5: The image of the faineants lounging around will stick in my mind.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are lazy or idle.
meanings.sent1: The faineants gathered on the couch to watch TV.
meanings.sent2: The manager warned the faineants about their lack of productivity.
meanings.sent3: The faineants formed a club for napping enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The faineants resembled a herd of lazy sheep, grazing aimlessly.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the faineants loitering around the office was unforgettable.
